website_summaries.verdict: The ultra-wide AOC C3583FQ is a huge, curved gaming monitor that uses speedy refresh rates and AMD's FreeSync technology for smooth gaming performance.

customer_reviews.title: Ghosting/black smearing issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice looking monitor and on paper the specs are great for the price. There is also a lot to like, the brightness and constrast are very nice, the bezels are very thin and FreeSync 2 support is great. Unfortunately the panel seems to be too slow for 144 Hz which results in very noticeable ghosting/black smearing issues. Sometimes this manifests as a distracting flicker during abrupt quick movements such as scrolling a web page or moving the camera in a game. There is also a bit of backlight bleeding. It's noticeable when the room is dark, but it's not too bad and it wouldn't be a problem for me on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, but using the menu is a pain
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical once I bought this and wondered if I made a mistake until I started usi9ng it. The curved widescreen has the same benefit of having 2 monitors, and also made me realize how much more eye strain lower tier monitors cause. The only downside is it only has one button to configure EVERYTHING (the button moves in all directions) and it is a pain to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Shrabster

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is excellent, sturdy and feels quality. Display is phenomenal, G-Sync makes everything as smooth as butter. I found having the one button for the menu display, whilst annoying compared to other monitors, it wasn't really a problem once you learn how to use it, and I don't use it often anyway, just at initial setup. Buy this monitor, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Was worried with all the bad quality reviews. Gave them a chance possibly the quality has improved with time I got a flawless panel (so far 2 days). The screen is beautiful, great for general work, photo and most of all gaming, g sync works great at 165hz it’s night and day difference from using standard 60hz refresh rates. Very easy on your eyes no blurr or judder. Looks a well made quality item. My one was manafactured in July 2019 so is a recent build. Update: Still going great after 5 months, no problems .
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: IT IS FECKING BIG!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty packaging. I returned a faulty monitor of similar specs to another retailer and this monitors packaging is 50%bigger. Very good and solid adjustable stand. Pixie quality seems pretty good and I have done a bit of gameplay with quake champions and no ghosting visible to my aged eyes. Pleased with it, though it is fecking huge compared with mu previous 24" ips monitor
customer_reviews.author: Andy Wales

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor, unless HDR is a big deal to you.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is supports a 144hz refresh rate, and is in general quite nice. You can sort of see the pixels in the curved areas. Don't know how to explain it. Looks like crosshatching. I don't like that. If you can ignore that, the monitor is good in general. Rather big. But do be careful. If you are thinking about buying this for an excellent HDR experience, don't. HDR1000 is considered the minimum to actually 'experience' HDR, it seems. HDR 400, is the 'entry level' HDR. Some things look nice in it. Some not really changed.
customer_reviews.author: 匿名

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 11 months
customer_reviews.text: Was really pleased with this screen for 11-months until it suddenly went completely dark whist playing a game. I've not been able to get it working since, no matter what I connect it to or what cable/port I use, the screen is completely dead. I'm currently two-weeks into the painful warranty process with AOC. After a bit of back and forth with silly emails ('please try a different cable' etc), they've agreed to send a replacement in-exchange for the faulty monitor... but I'm still waiting for them to actually do it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good 120hz gaming and work monitor
customer_reviews.text: Bought on a recommendation from a friend for work and play and it is a very good monitor. Solid and bright panel and lots of space for developing and playing games like the Witcher 3 look excellent with gsync. Downsides: Menu isn't great (but when are they ever) and there is a flicker with the first line across the screen. Looked online and it seems to be common. When I mentioned to my friend he only just realised it happens on his also so it's not that noticeable. I hardly notice it either unless I have a browser window up the top right. Moving the windows menu from the bottom to the top makes it less obvious.
customer_reviews.author: Nevl

customer_reviews.title: 144Hz @ 2k - Lower Price, no draw backs
customer_reviews.text: Zero screen bleed, UK Cables provided, Display Port Cable & HDMI's provided, Plug 'n' Play Setup, Adjustable height and viewing angle perfect. As with any high end monitor, there are a lot of image quality settings you can adjust, spend time on these and save the presets - the handy remote control will allow easy swapping between these settings. Monitor is life changing for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Emma R

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming, Browsing a little strange
customer_reviews.text: You need a good graphics card for this screen. I'm using an NVidia 1080ti which gives 120fps (the top frame rate for the monitor) on display port in Forza Horizon. When using display port you have to switch the monitor manually. Move the control stick at the bottom of the screen to the left (that's it). If you every boot up and the screen is blank, move the control stick to the left again. Browsing the web feels a little strange because the address bar is in the centre of the screen and doesn't nearly reach the screen width. The screen is very easy to look at and play games on for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good match for my Nvidia Graphics Card
customer_reviews.text: Really like the build quality. All the leads to hook up to my rig were included. I bought this to replace my old Samsung Monitor which had started to flicker badly. I needed a Monitor for gaming with the NVIDIA G-SYNC capability. The display is really great in game. Out of the box the display was exceptionally bright..... Still working on adjusting the colors :) Early days yet but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sira

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I deliberated for ages over which ultra wide monitor to buy. I read feedback, reviews, as well as online videos, I got even more confused, there is so much choice. I eventually decided on this one, I am so pleased with it. Good stand, great screen. The only slight negative (and it is slight) is that the screen setup uses a single button at the bottom which for me wasn't intuitive. Having said that, the setup only has to be done once. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Ashton

customer_reviews.title: 240hz doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I get a white screen randomly every couple of minutes. Tried new cable, drivers, blah blah. No, its definitely the monitor. Just google '240hz white screen' and you'll see all the other poor people with the same problem. My advice, stick to the BenQ 144hz that everybody else uses. I will. Also, the colours are weird The settings are crazy. Assembly is kind of long, you need a screwdriver and lots of floor space. And the speakers sound like when you turn your headphones up too loud and you can hear them from across the room This monitor is the 'cheapest' 240hz monitor for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Blake

customer_reviews.title: Poor image quality but 240hz is bae
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 60hz to 240hz and yes, it's worth it. However, the image quality of this monitor seems very poor. It appears only 720p (although it is 1080p) and the colours are very - hard to describe - but off. I'm aware this is a TN panel and not ips but even just playing fortnite, the image quality is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Jack F.

customer_reviews.title: Good but a big BUT
customer_reviews.text: Well the HDR makes everything look off color. I don't detect any bright HDR effects. It dims the monitor all the time then when bright effects happen they appear no more than better than my old monitor. Colours just look off all the time. Especially U tube. Nothing like a HDR TV. So disappointing. (I prefer my older monitor).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kinsella

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: For the money I paid this is very good value. No problem getting Freesync to work with an Nvidia GPU. Very happy with the picture quality in windows. More than adequate for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Expectations met.  :-)
customer_reviews.text: Got mine as a Warehouse return for £645 so that might make me a bit biased. Very happy with the monitor, the menu is quite different to use but i found a video on YouTube that clarified things for me, it's not cryptically bad just unusual. I can't speak for hardcore gaming but for the likes of Borderlands 2, Path Of Exile, the older Total War games and Guild Wars 2 everything worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: hb6886

customer_reviews.title: If you want 1440p with fast refresh rates and don't ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want 1440p with fast refresh rates and don't want to re-mortgage the house, this is the monitor for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bang for you buck Gsync monitor
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a brilliant little monitor for the price, easy to overclock to 165 Hz, and the fact it only costs £380 for Gsync display made it worth it for me. The only negatives was that the menu is a bit clunky with no presets, Set to 100 percent scaling in Windows 10 to see more of your screen.
customer_reviews.author: Jasey

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor. Better colors that I expected from a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. Better colors that I expected from a TN panel. The 240hz are amazing. One problem tough.... There seems to be a bug with the monitor, and you can't turn off Freesync if you are using an AMD card, and if you cant turn off freesync, you cant use the "reduce input lag" function. Hope they fix this soon.
customer_reviews.author: Yamil Succar

customer_reviews.title: Great, with bleeding effect as usual
customer_reviews.text: A breathtaking change from a 15 inch Full HD screen of a laptop. If you got an Nvidia card and have the high-end PC, this is one of the ways to go. Unfortunately, my model was also imperfect as I got the bleeding effect as people before me, which is unbearable - fortunately in everyday practice I'm hardly seeing it. Then again, having paid 500+ quid I'd love to have something a bit more solid. Nonetheless, this is a great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for months and it is pretty perfect for me. I have not had a single problem with it and it works great with an NVidia Card, when it comes to the Freesync. So yes. I am very happy with this monitor. And I feel the price is very good, for what you get. If you can get it for 250 to 280 GBP, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Quality monitor, now GSync Compatible!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful monitor just one minor niggle - the monitor has a matte finish that appears grainy on white backgrounds, like Word or Powerpoint. Otherwise its fantastic,no dead pixels! Does 1440p 144Hz through HDMI 2.0(Nvidia GTX 9xx upwards/R9 2xx) and Display Port. Speakea suck though get some headphones. Edit: This monitor is one of (currently) 12 Gsync compatible monitors(The one's Nvidia has certified). GSync works INCREDIBLE with my RTX 2060, but you can't get the Gsync compatibility working on a card prior to the Pascal or GTX 1xxx series :(
customer_reviews.author: Coleh

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price. + includes G-SYNC
customer_reviews.text: This is a review written by a person who used a 75hz 1080p TN monitor for nearly 8 years. And the boost in picture clarity and resoultion is very noticable. AND THE MOST IMPORTANT THING THAT THEY DON"T MENTION, this monitor officially supports G-SYNC by nvidia. It works and it's easy to setup, basically download the latest drivers for your gtx 10series or rtx series card and you are good to go. Comparing to a 150 pound TN monitor, the colours, brightness and viewing angles are very good. Overall very good TN monitor, definetely recommend this but would recommend more the 27 inch version which would better use the 1440p panel
customer_reviews.author: rafal galka

customer_reviews.title: Very nice monitor. Pairs well with my other peripherals I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monitor. Pairs well with my other peripherals I have going on. I'm currently running 2k Res looks amazing, the 165Hz makes for a smooth and enjoying experience. It's suprisingly heavy, due to the metal back support for the monitor makes for a sturdy and durable monitor. I played 3 games of CSGO as supreme level, 30+ frags.
customer_reviews.author: Flabberwockie

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for money got on wharehouse deals
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid I can really fault this unit ,with my 1070 it looked brilliant though dropped on some FPS which wasn’t monitor .i ended up with 3700x Ryzen and 2060s . I began my quest for top gaming and I love it
customer_reviews.author: J. A. johnston

customer_reviews.title: the 240hz refresh rate works as it should and the panel looks nice too. The monitor stand is poor
customer_reviews.text: As one of the cheaper 240hz displays, there are obviously some perks that you will miss out on compared to the bigger brands. Regardless, the 240hz refresh rate works as it should and the panel looks nice too. The monitor stand is poor, so you'll want to replace that if you can. My computer suffered some incompatibility issues with my Nvidia card, though that may be the case with any Freesync monitor. Avoid if you have an Nvidia GPU, unless you don't mind your screen occasionally going black when you play games.
customer_reviews.author: Christian V

customer_reviews.title: AOC AGON AG241QX 23.8" QHD (2560x1440) Freesync 144Hz 1ms Gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Superb value for money. Plenty of sockets for compatibility. Supplied with all the necessary cables. Four stars, only because of for poor viewing angle, otherwise, a great piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: amazonite

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with it. Could be cheaper (a little bit)
customer_reviews.text: The speakers are not so so and the headset holder is on the right side of the monitor witch make no sense because at 80% of the time your PC desctop would be on the left side on the desk. Also the stand is quite to big and heavy. I brought 144hz (24'') and I am happy with it because it's perfect for gaming, drawing and pretty much everything you want. It looks cool. Has many USB slots and many options on his own menu.
customer_reviews.author: Zhaklin Kolentsova

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother RMA
customer_reviews.text: Monitor 1 - Back Light bleed - RMA'd Lost details - RMA'd again - lost - details sent three times Delivered to wrong address Monitor 2 arrived- Worse Back Light bleed - RMA'd Tried to contact AOC, referred to technicial, no response, message on social media read, but ignored Monitor 3 arrives - display port problem, tried 6 different cables including that display in the box, 60hz fine, 85hz unstable, +100hz plus no signal My 4k60 display and ultrawide 100hz works fine so not GPU This monitor and company sucks! spend a few extra quid and get a better brand/ASUS/ROG etc etc
customer_reviews.author: cscooepr

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor
customer_reviews.text: Pros + Quality finish and nice asthetics + Good screen quality and colours (for a TN panel) + No dead pixels, not too much light bleed Cons - The speakers sound garbage, would recommend getting external speakers if you consider this monitor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Backlight Flicker
customer_reviews.text: After testing with several cables and power sources, it's clear that this isn't a good freesync monitor. Many freesync games have a clear backlight flicker which is at best distracting and headache inducing at worse. It's otherwise a good looking monitor, but freesync being essentially broken is a deal-breaker. On top of this, the UI for editing settings is hilariously poorly designed and buggy and you'll find yourself having to re enter settings repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Madigan

customer_reviews.title: Awful Ghosting Issues
customer_reviews.text: Worst quality panel I've ever seen. The ultrawide experience is great, but do yourself a favour and spend a bit more on something that isn't this.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Layzell

customer_reviews.title: Sniped a "like new" for £390 from warehouse won the panel lotto!
customer_reviews.text: Love this monitor brings the division 2 to life on my machine. I took a gamble and purchased a "like new" from amz warehouse for £390 which is an amazing deal. I was so lucky it wasnt actually even used, all the cabes were still sealed, the monitor had never been turned on. to top it off I ended up with hardly any backlight bleed or any of the other common problems people have mentioned in the reviews. Needless to say im totally chuffed with this! even at the current price its great at £550 considering its the same panel that goes into £800 monitors!
customer_reviews.author: Darmesh Valambhia

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, Strange coating on the panel.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is exactly what is advertised a 1440p high refresh rate monitor perfect for gaming, there is nearly no ghosting and the colours are great for a TN panel. what i find strange about the monitor however is the very odd anti-glare coating that some people claim blurs the image but in my experience it is only noticeable if the panel is showing a very bright white picture. overall a great value for money monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Filip Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: This is an ideal gaming monitor for high end computers on fast paced DMC/COD games.
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor for the price that it comes at. Very good for less demanding games were I can get 1440p 144hz. But obviously not ideal for low end computers. Positives Good controls Lots of options See high quality detail with 1440p. Lots of screen relistate. Very high stand build quality and adjustability. Negatives Certain amount of back glow. Can be so bright that it hurts my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good value monitor
customer_reviews.text: I think my only qualm with it is the poor built in speaker quality , the colours are great , it is 1440p at 144hz and Nvidia cards can use G sync on it even though its only freesync compatible. I have noticed a definite improvement in video content since purchasing the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: nice resolution
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking monitor,came with all the cables you could want and software, The only thing i did'ent like was the controls for setting up screen etc otherwise 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: graham davies

customer_reviews.title: Great Price-Quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, good for gaming (playing at 1440p/144ghz + Freesync it's amazing), the colors need just and adjustment but once you did it looks really good. Pros Price 30-144Hz FreeSync range Bright picture Great color after calibration Stand quality Cons Built-in Speakers Quality
customer_reviews.author: Shido

customer_reviews.title: 100HZ instead of 120HZ
customer_reviews.text: Was a tad misleading in saying "120HZ". Have tried multiple times but it will not allow anything post 100HZ have tried in Nvidia OC setting and 3rd party tools. Don't get me wrong 1440p at 100HZ is nice but a bit extra would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence

customer_reviews.title: Very nice monitor. The difference between 144hz and 240hz was ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monitor. The difference between 144hz and 240hz was motion clarity and you notice your cursor or crosshair move much smoother. Not having G-sync won't make a huge deal if this is for CS:Go or Overwatch as the difference isnt as noticeable especially if ur rig can hit 240fps without a sweat. If You can't then I suggest getting Gsync 100%. Other than that amazing monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Ludba

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor for Gaming and everything really and it’s height is adjustable and you can move it from one side to the other and their are multiple HDMIs on it so you can connect a console to it too and their are nice lights on it and overall it’s a great monitor so I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great screen for the price
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is good for the price, really bright though, going to make eyes burn if you wont use correct settings. Its a VA panel so picture quality is great, makes a great for casual gaming like tripple A titles, as well as for competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolajus

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor if you manage to get one with minimal to no defects
customer_reviews.text: After trying my luck with the Acer predator line multiple times, I tried the aoc, great monitor other than the slight ips glow on the bottom right
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed W.

customer_reviews.title: Poor colour, poor back light, poor QC, do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Colour uniformatity is very poor, half the screen has a green tint whereas the other half has a red tint. Back light bleed is also horrendous and is a sharp angular batman shape. Forigen material under the glass (in between the surface and the pixel) as well. Liteslly unusable, return after 5 min of usage.
customer_reviews.author: P. H. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Amazing looking
customer_reviews.text: Amazing looking monitor no dead pixels hardly any back light bleed and games look fantastic on it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: not built very well at all
customer_reviews.text: this is my second monitor and its still broke the 1st monitor turned off for a split second with the slightest of movement of my desk got another 1 on warranty and this 1 half the panel comes up with thin red vertical lines and i have to tap the back of the monitor to remove them temporarily
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Very bad screen
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I can’t give a good review for this, there’s a really weird grainy effect on light surfaces, looks like a cheap phone protector. Makes screen looks wet/ dirty
customer_reviews.author: Jessie hale

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monitor was concerned after reading some of the reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Monitor was concerned after reading some of the reviews but decided to go ahead and take the chance and I am completely glad i did, how was I ever managing to play games before lol
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased, paired it with the RTX 2080 and it works like a charm! Very smooth picture quality, paired with 240hz refresh rate makes for some stunning visuals
customer_reviews.author: Mr T

customer_reviews.title: Gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: One of the best gaming monitor which one i had. Perfect quality screen 2k res. And 144hz . Using already for half year no dead pixels or anything 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Lukas Randamanskas

customer_reviews.title: Super picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Superb gaming screen!! Quick response time and absolutely stunning picture quality!
customer_reviews.author: chris joyce

customer_reviews.title: Decent monitor
customer_reviews.text: The monitor itself is decent, size is perfect and real easy to adjust. Only issue I had is that the box had no instruction manual inside and so no idea to put it together had to take a guess, turns out it was all on the CD provided however I have no CD drive
customer_reviews.author: Simon Staton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pic quality
customer_reviews.text: used for streaming films, playing games, pic quality is impressive. Sound is what you would expect from a monitor, I use a separate sound system anyways so not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: B M DIXON

customer_reviews.title: Great but flawed
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor but letdown by screen quality control. Found one dead pixel near the center of the screen, and didnt like the anti glare as it made whites into a grainy film. Luck of the draw with this monitor but if you just want a 2k 165hz gsync panel for gaming and general use this one is not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: winston

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: After playing on a TV that was 50HZ for a while, I decided that it was time for an upgrade. I looked around for 2/3 months and decided that this monitor was the one. I love this monitor so much! It is perfect! It feels so smooth and I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Diyar

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! The constructionion is solid. The image quality is good for a TN. It's got g-sync, 144hz refresh rate(165hz when overclocked). And 1440p resolution
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: White dot
customer_reviews.text: Really like it , but there is a white dot on screen left side and bottom , I did a stuck,dead pixel test and does not show up on it , so in two minds if too ask for a Replacement .....saying that this screen is very nice
customer_reviews.author: TheRide

customer_reviews.title: ONLY 144hz
customer_reviews.text: I thought i was buying a 240 hz moniter as is advertised but i am on my pc and it caps at 144hz
customer_reviews.author: sue griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Display Port failed
customer_reviews.text: Good display until display port stopped working after 5 months
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Wowzer
customer_reviews.text: Wowzer, unreal picture, 120hz G sync, coupled with a 2080ti its the dogs bollo#ks..
customer_reviews.author: Robert Taylerson Clark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor for this price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor for this price. 144hz! Tryed with a rtx 2080 TI and 3 monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Splinter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support 144hz on 2K resolution!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this monitor based on reviews for 2k 144hz monitor but doesn't support the frame rate at the resolution required! Will be returning as it's very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: J Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for gaming. Average for other uses I suppose
customer_reviews.text: Terrible monitor for gaming. I bought it to replace an Predator X34 which had extreme ghosting issues and images were just a blurry mess when looking around. This monitor is even worse with viable double and triple vision clearly seen in most levels of brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: if its going to work
customer_reviews.text: i dislike turning it on after about 3weeks ,and it would not power up. now it might be a one off, but my son is not impressed it was his xmas present, which is now on its way back to amazon 24/12/19. nice while it lasted
customer_reviews.author: mark evans

customer_reviews.title: Display already broken
customer_reviews.text: just opened the box and the all ready broken Display is broken. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this monitor. I could benefit of the same features (resolution etc) on a smaller form factor as I can see pixels, comparing to my MBP retina display.
customer_reviews.author: mrphyz

customer_reviews.title: Banging monitor
customer_reviews.text: Like the asjustable stand, solid build quality aswell. Very heavy so monitor cant be moved easily/fall over which is nice. Managed to grab it second hand aswell so was a bargain compared to RRP
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stunning visuals
customer_reviews.text: I think ive found the moniter for me, it looks absalutly stunning running at 144hz (maybe 165hz if youre lucky). 1440p resolution is a great res too. Only problem are the colours, but mainly gaming i feel the loss of colour is worth it but still worth adding the note about colour.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Bentley

customer_reviews.title: The cheapest 1440p 144hz monitor looks and works great
customer_reviews.text: This monitor looks and works great especially at its price!
customer_reviews.author: Emilsobo

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen I’m glad I bought it after reading the reviews and watching some videos on it
customer_reviews.author: LINDA

customer_reviews.title: Solid Gaming Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, no dead pixels, yes some backlight bleed but thats with all IPS. Games great with high refresh rate and G-SYNC.
customer_reviews.author: Rav London (UK)

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good piece of equipment. Only use it for typing so cannot say how it works for gaming : Can’t figure out the volume control .
customer_reviews.author: Abi Dare

customer_reviews.title: ... set up however it works very well and looks great. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Slightly difficult to set up however it works very well and looks great.Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. B

customer_reviews.title: One is better than two.
customer_reviews.text: Much better than having two monitors side by side. Excellent product though it is a lot of money. If gaming is your thing, consider this.
customer_reviews.author: KLT

customer_reviews.title: Dont Recommend For Fortnite
customer_reviews.text: there is way to much motion blur even when you have motion blur turned off, dont buy for fortnite
customer_reviews.author: Kieran Carr

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Can't ask for much more at this price, and considering how rare 24in 1440p monitors are in the market, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sreenath

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with it. The menu takes some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: Great Screen, the jump from a 16:9 monitor to this 21:9 has really added to the immersion in films and games. Solidly built, only negative for me so far is using the menu, which can be frustrating at times.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant monitor for gaming at 2k and no tearing with gsync. Sturdy heavy stand and easy to position panel.
customer_reviews.author: Zak Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: So cheap for 144hz and 1440p, best of both worlds, makes my 1080p monitor look bad..
customer_reviews.author: Christopher King

customer_reviews.title: too good choice
customer_reviews.text: too good choice pretty good colors. very smooth running the games solid construction and good quality
customer_reviews.author: panagiotopoulos

customer_reviews.title: just great
customer_reviews.text: gsync working flawlessly, but for this size need 4k resolution I think, panel little bit slow after tn, colors fine, hdr examle with division 2 is great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Image retention / burn-in image
customer_reviews.text: this monitor is really nice, but have significant image retention and after couple of weeks you will see significant burn-in faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: The best value for this money...the games run very smooth, a large spectrum of game color settings, very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Claudiu

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor
customer_reviews.text: Really nice monitor but with being an ultrawide monitor you have to put fixes into certain games to get them to display properly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It feels so real when you play games
customer_reviews.text: It is so good for gaming it is the best 24 inch monitor in the world
customer_reviews.author: leyla spencer

customer_reviews.title: One to rule them all
customer_reviews.text: If you dont get one of these, u are missing out. Gameing, photoshop, movies! One to rule them all
customer_reviews.author: Stefan L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but needs some colour calibration before using
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's pretty much unbeatable. The only downside is you have to spend quite a while fiddling with the colours to get it to look good. Out of the box the picture is very undersaturated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks the tits
customer_reviews.text: Perfect looking and works great I would say there was not a user manual or instructions but Google the manual and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: MR S P MAIDENS

customer_reviews.title: Bad grainy look, looks worse than 1080p
customer_reviews.text: Horrible grainy look, had to return, blacks look awful and create a lot of noise too, awful for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Yusuf

customer_reviews.title: DP cable flawed
customer_reviews.text: The DP cable that comes with the monitor only works in a one direction. It also prevent the monitor from going to 144Hz at 1440p. The problem disappears right after I change the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Lau Ka Hei Justin

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I use for my gaming set up and it's amazing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth AF
customer_reviews.text: This is the pinnacle of monitors for its intended purpose = GAMING
customer_reviews.author: Subby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best. Highly impressive, exactly as described. Highly recommend if your into a serious monitor
customer_reviews.author: celeste

customer_reviews.title: Good value - works well and position esily adjustable, unlike my other screen.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen - pity about the poorly placed menu button, but once sorted, I don't expect to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: John Randall

customer_reviews.title: Solid build quality Great colour I got no dead pixel Pro
customer_reviews.text: It's the cheapest 165hz g-sync ips monitor you can get. Pro: Solid build quality Great colour I got no dead pixel Con: weak speaker the look.......i think
customer_reviews.author: CHEUNG POK LUN

customer_reviews.title: No Backlight Bleeding Rectangle on mine!
customer_reviews.text: High quality TN panel, lots of ports!, beautiful design, I'm very happy with it. I saw some units with a weird "Backlight bleeding Rectangle" on forums after I made my orden. Luckily mine didn't have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor for over a year now, absolutely love it. Destiny 2 at 1440p 144fps looks fecking mint. Top notch
customer_reviews.author: Graeme Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect delivery time
customer_reviews.text: Perfect delivery time! And a great product, take me a while configurate the accurate colors and contrast, but well i done, looks very good for a TN panel. Totally recomended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor but...
customer_reviews.text: I personally found the backlight bleed on this monitor a little too much so I decided to return the monitor. Excellent customer service by amazon. I have attached pictures to show the issue I'm talking about and only really becomes an issues when using in a dark room. Some may not notice the bleed at all. Other than this issue the monitor does exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: E

product_meta.title: AOC AGON AG352QCX 35" Curved MVA LED WFHD (2560x1080) 21:9 Freesync 200Hz Gaming monitor with Built-in speakers. (VGA, DVI, HDMI, DisplayPort, USB 3.0 x 2) - Height adjust
product_meta.description:
Size Name:35" - Curved WFHD| Style Name:200HzArmed with a huge 35-inch curved MVA panel in 21: 9 format, This monitor immerses gamers deeper into virtual worlds than ever before. It is equipped with Adaptive-Sync (supporting free Sync technology) and a refresh rate of 200Hz for an ultra-smooth gaming experience. Signal Input HDMI 2.0 x 1, DisplayPort 1.2 x 1, VGA, DVI. USB input USB 3.0 x 2. Built-in Speakers 5 W x 2

BOX CONTAINS
Monitor / HDMI / VGA / Displayport / Audio / Power cables
feature_bullets: Freesync - Delivers smooth gameplay eliminating input lag, screen tear and stuttering

WFHD - Wide Full HD offers superior picture quality and crisp imagery that reveals every detail. The widescreen 21:9 aspect ratio is perfect for watching movies in an expansive format or immersing yourself in the latest game
200Hz Refresh rate - Unleash the full potential of your graphics card: with screen tearing and motion blur and stuttering all eradicated, your game will finally flow like it was meant to.
Height Adjustable stand - Raise and lower the screen to suit your height and seating preferences

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars790 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
